title: UPDATE: One injured in accidental shooting in Lafayette
content:
UPDATE 8:45 a.m.
A man was injured late Sunday night in an accidental shooting in Lafayette.
Police responded to reports of a gunshot victim on the 900 block of East. Simcoe Street at 11:45 p.m. Sunday. According to a press release from the Lafayette Police Department, the victim, a 31-year-old black man, was found in a parking lot with a single gunshot wound.
The man was transported to a local hospital, where he is listed in stable condition.
Police determined that the victim suffered an unintentional self-inflicted gunshot wound, LPD confirmed Monday morning. There are no suspects in the shooting.
